flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
When we opened our box of junk from American Science & Surplus, we decided that it was properly named. It was a box of junk!

The ideas we had of using the junk included some sort of musical instrument and a waffle maker. Having not eaten anything, we all decided to try to make an automatic waffle machine. That quickly evolved into a pancake machine since we didn't have any tools to machine our own grills.

This project is a documentary of our making of the Pancake Maker but not a step-by-step guide. Although we don't have all the steps to making your own pancake machine, hopefully, this will give a general idea of what to do and not do.
guide.introduction_rendered:
When we opened our box of junk from American Science & Surplus, we decided that it was properly named. It was a box of junk!

The ideas we had of using the junk included some sort of musical instrument and a waffle maker. Having not eaten anything, we all decided to try to make an automatic waffle machine. That quickly evolved into a pancake machine since we didn't have any tools to machine our own grills.

This project is a documentary of our making of the Pancake Maker but not a step-by-step guide. Although we don't have all the steps to making your own pancake machine, hopefully, this will give a general idea of what to do and not do.

Relevant parts
  • Phone cord
  • Wall plate
  • Phone modular wiring block
  • TV antenna splitter
  • Antenna
  • Heating element
  • Momentary switch
  • Light bulb sockets
  • LED
  • DC power supply
  • AC transformer
  • Battery
  • Lithium-ion battery
  • Wall hook
  • Wall hook
  • Suction hooks
  • Rotating plant hangers
  • Toilet seat hinges
  • Basin stopper
  • Door stoppers
  • Nylon bushing
  • Wooden rings
  • Electronic bell

steps.title: Making the funnel for the mixer

lines.text: We used our laser cutter a lot for this project. Here we have an acrylic funnel made by stacking expanding rings of acrylic.
lines.text_raw: We used our laser cutter a lot for this project. Here we have an acrylic funnel made by stacking expanding rings of acrylic.

lines.text: Here's Brian!
lines.text_raw: Here's Brian!

lines.text: It looks like he's building in the dark but that's just the flash from the camera.
lines.text_raw: It looks like he's building in the dark but that's just the flash from the camera.

lines.text: Brian glued the funnel onto a PVC tube. It can hold the mix and water now.
lines.text_raw: Brian glued the funnel onto a PVC tube. It can hold the mix and water now.

lines.text: On the top we made a lid and attached a motor to it. The parts were laser cut again.
lines.text_raw: On the top we made a lid and attached a motor to it. The parts were laser cut again.

lines.text: The valve is made by an acrylic sheet with a hole on one end. It's attached to a solenoid that's anchored to the platform for holding the mixer.
lines.text_raw: The valve is made by an acrylic sheet with a hole on one end. It's attached to a solenoid that's anchored to the platform for holding the mixer.

lines.text: When the solenoid is disengaged, the sheet covers the hole of the funnel, preventing the mix from escaping.
lines.text_raw: When the solenoid is disengaged, the sheet covers the hole of the funnel, preventing the mix from escaping.

lines.text: When the solenoid is activated, it pulls the sheet in and its hole lines up with the hole of the funnel, allowing the mix to pour out.
lines.text_raw: When the solenoid is activated, it pulls the sheet in and its hole lines up with the hole of the funnel, allowing the mix to pour out.
